result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Beth Ann Fletcher was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle, unless equipped with an Ignition Interlock Device.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant has 4 days credit, if revoked.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant entitled to earn good time per 973.09(1)(d) as calculated per 302.43. 
Granted release privileges under 303.08(1).

10:01 AM
ADA Kurczewski - present.
Attorney Robert Forseth - present.
Defendant - present.
PLQ filed with the Court.
NC plea entered to Ct#3.
Court questions defendant and advises of rights.
Court finds defendant waives her rights, finds a factual basis for her plea contained in the probable cause section of the criminal complaint.
Court finds defendant guilty of Ct#3.
Ct#1 to be dismissed outright.
Ct#2 to be dismissed and read in.
BAC - .307
Recommendations by ADA Kurczewski.
Recommendations by Atty. Forseth.
Court sentences defendant to 3 years probation (SW).
Conditions of probation:
 - Defendant to serve 60 days of conditional jail time - imposed, with good time and Huber - defendant to report immediately.
 - Defendant shall pay a fine of $2800 plus costs and blood draw fee, totaling $4601.50.
 - Defendant shall pay supervision fees.
 - Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
 - Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
 - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV. 
 - Defendant shall only operate a vehicle equipped with an Ignition Interlock Device.
Outside of probation:
Defendant has 4 days credit, if revoked..  
Driver's license revoked for a period of 36 months
Ignition Interlock Device : 36 months
